If you block a member on here they are right back on  the next day. There are more scammers and fake profiles on this website than there are true real members. Poor site management! Poor PR to customers! Poor site period! Furthermore  they have made some changes and it requires you to post a photo every time you want to send a friend request  comment on someone‚Äôs photo  ask someone a question  or pretty much anything. They froze my account for the second time in two months for absolutely no reason and they said it was because of ‚Äúsuspicious activity‚Äú on my page. I‚Äôm never one time logged out and log back in. They deleted my account so I would start a new one and they could impose all of their new changes on me. The support staff in this instance has been absolutely terrible. I have had emails completely ignored by the website when I have asked for help or explained a problem. I have been on this website since it was started and it has done nothing but go to hell in a handbasket. The amount of fake profiles and scammers on this website is astounding. Rabbit used to be a decent application where two people separated geographically could share a program or movie via Crunchyroll or Amazon.   Since Rabbit has been ‚ÄúUpdated‚Äù all video sharing has been abandoned.  The only website allowed is Netflix  and YouTube.  The only way to share a video off of YouTube is by sending the other person a link to the video.  This application basically downgraded itself to a glorified text messaging app.  After requesting assistance from Rabbit concerning their massive loss in usability and functionality  I was directed to kindly check back later as features were constantly being added. It has been several months and the app has yet to include a fraction of what it used to be.  I would highly recommend not waisting your time with this app and hopefully a suitable competitor will step up to the plate and take this app‚Äôs spot.

I think it‚Äôs clear which one I‚Äôd choose.

Overall i really enjoy rabbit  it‚Äôs a genuinely good app that has fairly decent customer support. However  as a mobile user  I have had some pretty major problems that are really frustrating. For one  when hosting or controlling a room on mobile  the controls are bizarre  with where I click and where the cursor shows up being about a literal inch an a half apart (on iPad  at least) making every movement a game of chance where I may exit the program instead of turn up the volume. In addition  the app has a tendency to kick me out of rooms someone else is hosting about once every ~25 minutes  which is more annoying than anything else. However  the chat function and program itself are genuinely very good  and I still use the app frequently.

Old review: Rabbit is one of the greatest ideas I've ever seen. Talk and chat with friends while watching and doing just about anything online? Yes please! It's very fun  easy to learn and use  and quite addictive--I've used it for more than a year and I'm on it most days of the week. There's not much to complain about except for random issues like YouTube videos reverting from full screen to small screen after a few seconds for no reason  or only 2 video quality options when there used to be 3  or script has stopped running" messages  or options like passing the remote to a friend that could be simplified with extra buttons. All in all though it's a fantastic tool and I'm so glad it exists and for free. ****  New review: what the heck is with these updates? First we lose SD video quality  then controlling the video on mobile becomes insanely hard and inconvenient  and now navigating the app is more confusing than ever with much fewer options than desktop. And every time I contact the devs to bring up my frustrations they do absolutely nothing about it! Rabbit... I love using you  but please get your droppings together. **"

At rabb.it that is. I love the app/site & hate it at the same time. I‚Äôve really held off way too long to leave a review. This has been a fairly popular site for a few years and on paper it‚Äôs an awesome idea! But why haven‚Äôt the creators figured it out yet...?  Before the site was difficult for me to navigate  and certain things would take forever to load (trust me it‚Äôs not just my connection).  It had big update recently; haven‚Äôt used the app in maybe a month so I‚Äôm not sure exactly what day it updated.  I actually LIKED the mobile update  cause it was a little more simple to navigate & it allowed me to save log ins.  One complaint about the features is that there‚Äôs no cursor option now  which is okay but I think there will be times that I need it. Also rabb.it does have its own time bar but if I try to rewind or skip  or accidentally click the screen  then it restarts the whole episode and I can‚Äôt fix it.  Now onto my main complaints... THE MOBILE UPDATE IS SO BUGGY. Like one day I couldn‚Äôt even view my logins  they refused to load. Another day NONE of the search bars would work; I‚Äôd try to look up a show I searched before & it wouldn‚Äôt even give any me suggestions.  I couldn‚Äôt enter a URL either  even if it was the homepage of a site that I had just copy & pasted from my browser.  Also I don‚Äôt THINK the mobile version is compatible with the desktop version? Because apparently only mobile  not desktop  has ‚Äúgroups‚Äù which is a new feature it seems. When you click ‚Äúwatch now‚Äù on mobiles  it seems automatically makes a group for you/takes you to the last group you were in  not to your room?? Anyways now the show I‚Äôm watching isn‚Äôt loading correctly  it doesn‚Äôt seem to be starting at the right time  and it only has audio while the screen is all black.... A lot of the functions - photos  calendar  and a private chat - are really nice and enjoyable to use  but I do have an issue with a bug and also the feasibility of the calendar function.  1. For the call function  every time I hit the call button and start a call  if I have to end the call and call again  I cannot start a call through the call buttons (either in chat or by clicking on their profile) unless I restart the app  which I assume resets the button click function. Not sure how the program works but adding a flag for in call may be helpful. Slight bug but causes a slight inconvenience which gets annoying overtime.  2. Also for the call function  it would be nice if there was a video call and hold function  which seem to be pretty standard across social apps.  3. I like the overall idea of the calendar and I think it's pretty awesome to be able to have my events  my so's events  and shared events  but the fact that you cannot import or sync calendars from either apple or google calendars is really inconvenient. I'm surprised that there's an option to export single events  but again  it would be much easier to export the whole calendar as well. I have all my events and tagged logged in my apple/google calendars (about 30-40 events a week)  which also give me appropriate notifications along with travel times. For me to have to manually input each event once again in the Between calendar is a lot of extra time  so I end up not using the function  even though I really enjoy the idea.  I think if these functions were fixed/added  especially the calendar  I would invest in premium  but at this point  the app acts more like a regular messaging app. Although it separates my conversations with one person with the rest  I can also do that with any other messaging app  but only add one friend on it. Overall  pretty good idea but execution needs to be refined more.

UPDATE 9/14: Still no communication from Between or official fixes  but I did find a way to download an old version. 5.2.2 is the last version that actually works. We‚Äôre able to use the app again  but the lack of support (not to mention the issue in the first place!) is unacceptable. Leaving this at 1* until they actually fix the problem.   UPDATE 8/3: 5.3.3 made it WORSE! Previously my partners phone worked correctly. Now BOTH of our devices are saving all sent pictures to the camera roll.   UPDATE 7/10: 5.3.2 still broken. Support still hasn't responded to me. I guess it's only been a month  so...  UPDATE 7/4/18: version 5.3.1 still has the issue. I've done a factory restore and it hasn't helped. I did get a response from the dev - thanking me for my suggestion to automatically save pics to the camera roll  but letting me know that since this is a privacy focused app  they may not implement my idea. My rage knows no bounds.   UPDATE 6/19/18: New version of the app - yay! Issue still exists - booo! First active developer I've ever encountered who ignores support emails and Facebook/Instagram DMs. I never would have bought Plus if I'd known they cared so little.   UPDATE 6/17/18: Three weeks later  the developer is STILL totally MIA. No we're aware of the issue." No "Can we get more information?" Nothing. I've sent follow up emails. I've tried messaging them on Facebook (their bot just sends you to the same worthless email). The "Report a Problem" link here goes to the same email too. If you're going to have one email  how about actually checking it occassionally?  Original review: As a long time user and recent Between Plus lifetime subscriber  I'm really sad to be writing a one star review. However  I recently discovered something that's a HUGE issue for a privacy app like this. When my partner sends a picture  it automatically saves a copy to the camera roll. This doesn't happen on my phone  nor is there a setting to disable it (that I've found  anyways). I've written to Between support asking for help  but there has been no response. The potential embarrassment of this issue is huge. Fortunately WE found the issue instead of our kids or a friend.   Until this gets fixed  the app is useless to us. There are plenty of other encrypted messenger apps. If the developer cares enough to either fix the issue or respond to my pleas for help (it's only been two weeks of complete silence)  I'll update this review."

My boyfriend and I have been long distance for a while  and this app has been phenomenal! We can also voice call (no video call  sorry!) or chat via the personal message feature. I like the inherent privacy that the app provides... it‚Äôs a special place for just me and my partner! I would highly recommend this app for any long distance couple!

I've had this app since it came out  and have used it so much since I know how to use it with my eyes shut. I've met friends  girlfriends  and just people who are good to chat with through it.   In some of the more recent updates there's been some issues; like search distance inaccuracy  failure to update  and messages not sending  but these are the worst. Fix these small annoyances and the rating is right back up to five.   Overall  Whoshere is one of those staple apps out there for sociability. Perhaps allowing a larger pool of search results would be nicer  but this app does what it does the best and to date there's nothing similar that's even slightly better.

Pros: I like that I can check detailed stats wherever and I love that I can change my loadout on the fly between rounds.   Cons: I really dislike how many little bugs there are and I absolutely hate the one big one I've found in particular:  - If I open this app while I'm signed in and playing BF1 on console I will immediately be booted from any game that may be in progress and I am taken back to the home screen with no connection to EA servers. This can happen at any point  not just in a match  and occurs about 20% of the time. (XboxOne. iPhone6)  I like the potential here  but I frankly don't think this app does anything more than add to the long list of issues your games already have. Fix the core issues first and then start bolting on the bells and whistles...

Ok  battlefield 1 is great in general  it's my first battlefield and  I was already willing to by a premium pass the day I got it. Then I wondered  if there was a app like many other games had. It was so awesome. The first few things I saw was the medal I was tracking and if I tapped on it  it showed my how far though with it I was. The next page let me see all my dog tags and ones I don't have   if I didn't have it. I was able to look at the camp task I needed to do to get It. After that  I was able to make a in game patch for my self. It was so cool. The next thing was that i could see if my friends where playing the game. It's definitely worth getting

I appreciate that DICE did this. The app works how it should  and despite the crippling bugs  I will give it four stars because I am confident they will address the bugs and fix them. When that happens I will give them five stars.  The bug I've encountered is that in game loadouts get reset when I use the app  and vice versa. This is really annoying since I'm very particular with my loadouts. I will not use the app until this is addressed.
